required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacological Prophylaxis of Post- Endoscopic Retrograde Cholangiopancreatography (ERCP) Pancreatitis
clinical_study.official_title: Comparative Evaluation of Standard Prophylaxis Versus Divided-dose NSAIDs or Hybrid NSAID and N-acetylcysteine Therapy for the Prevention of Post-ERCP Pancreatitis

lead_sponsor.agency: Grigore T. Popa University of Medicine and Pharmacy

clinical_study.source: Grigore T. Popa University of Medicine and Pharmacy

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators aimed to perform a comparative study, evaluating the efficacy of three prophylactic approaches aiming to reduce the risk of post-ERCP pancreatitis, using pharmacologic agents with different mechanisms of action (NSAIDs and/or acetylcysteine) in three different regimens.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients who develop post ERCP pancreatitis
primary_outcome.description: Comparing and evaluating the efficacy of three pharmacological combination therapies (Indomethacin +/- N-acetylcysteine), aiming to prevent acute post ERCP pancreatitis

arm_group.description: Control group - patients receiving 100 mg indomethacin suppository immediately post ERCP
Group A - patients receiving N-acetylcysteine (NAC) 600 mg before performing ERCP and indomethacin suppository 50 mg before and after performing ERCP
Group B - patients receiving indomethacin suppository 50 mg before and 50 mg after ERCP

intervention.description: the investigators aimed to perform a comparative study, evaluating the efficacy of three prophylactic approaches aiming to reduce the risk of PEP, using indomethacin and/or N-acetylcysteine -NAC, in different regimens

the investigators aimed to perform a comparative study, evaluating the efficacy of three prophylactic approaches aiming to reduce the risk of PEP, using indomethacin and/or N-acetylcysteine -NAC, in different regimens

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age 18 years and older
- diagnosis of choledocholithiasis
- indication for ERCP procedures
- willingness to participate in the study
- the ability to sign the informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- presence of acute pancreatitis or other inflammatory diseases at admission
- pregnancy
- contraindication for NSAID administration
- recent episode of upper digestive bleeding (less than one month)
- hypersensibility to antioxidants hypersensibility to antioxidants
- the necessity of a prophylactic pancreatic stent insertion
- patients' disapproval to take part in the study

facility.name: Institute of Gastroenterology and Hepatology - St. Spiridon County Clinical Emergency Hospital of Iași
